greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct primorials in the greedy sum of primorials adding to A108951(n).
comment: The greedy sum is also the sum with the minimal number of primorials used in the primorial base representation.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
example: For n = 18 = 2 * 3^2, A108951(18) = A034386(2) * A034386(3)^2 = 2 * 6^2 = 72 = 2*A002110(3) + 2*A002110(2) = 2*30 + 2*6, and because there occurs only two distinct primorials (30 and 6) in the sum, we have a(18) = 2.
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 11 2019
